div.p: KIMBERLEE A. SHAUMAN Department of Sociology Phone: (530) 297-­‐8072 University of California – Davis Fax: (530) 752-­‐0783 One Shields Ave., Davis, CA 95616 E-­‐mail: kashauman@ucdavis.edu
EDUCATION
Ph.D. University of Michigan, Ann Arbor Sociology, Population Demography and Ecology: August, 1997 Dissertation: “The Education of Scientists: Gender Differences During the Early Life Course”
M.A. University of Michigan, Ann Arbor Sociology: May, 1994
B.A. University of Michigan, Ann Arbor Sociology: May, 1992 B.A. awarded with High Honors, College of Literature, Science, and the Arts
CURRENT AND PRIOR POSITIONS
Professor of Sociology, University of California at Davis, 2013-­‐present.
Associate Professor of Sociology, University of California at Davis, 2005-­‐2013.
Associate Director, UC Davis ADVANCE Program, 2013-­‐2014.
Director, UC Davis ADVANCE Program, 2012-­‐2013.
Director, Social Science Data Service, University of California, Davis, 2012-­‐2013.
Director, Economy, Justice and Society Program, University of California, Davis, 2011-­‐2012.
Assistant Professor of Sociology, University of California at Davis, 1997-­‐2005.
Statistical Consultant, Population Studies Center, University of Michigan, 1995-­‐1996.
NIH/NICHD Trainee and Research Assistant, Department of Sociology and Population Studies Center, University of Michigan, 1992-­‐1997.

impact of the gender composition and competitiveness of class contexts on achievement and choice of major
Co-­‐PI: Michal Kurlaender, School of Education, UC Davis

RESEARCH AND TEACHING INTERESTS
Social stratification, family and kinship, sociology of education, work and occupations, gender, adolescence, demography, quantitative methodology.

Competition” in 2008; “Does inequality make us sick?” in 2009, 2010)
